head.title: National Briefing | Science And Health: Last 7 Months Were Warmest Stretch On Record

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Science And Health: Last 7 Months Were Warmest Stretch On Record
hedline.hl2: Last 7 Months Were Warmest Stretch on Record

block.p: The first seven months of 2006 were the warmest such stretch in the continental United States for any year since climate record-keeping began in 1895, federal scientists said. Scorching temperatures in July, particularly strings of hot nights, were almost certainly related in part to the continuing buildup of heat-trapping smokestack and tailpipe gases linked to global warming, said Jay Lawrimore of the National Climatic Data Center. ''The long-term trend we're seeing cannot be explained without the influence of greenhouse gases,'' Mr. Lawrimore said.
